overview:
David King is a co-founder of BestInClass.com, a personalized product recommendation service. Prior to starting BestInClass.com in 2006, he was the VP in charge of the Online Platform and the CTO for EA Online at Electronic Arts.

David is also a founder of Pogo.com, which is the most popular U.S. casual games Internet site and a top-5 Internet site when measured by total time spent on the site. Electronic Arts acquired Pogo in 2001. Prior to Pogo.com he co-founded Outland, the first commercial Internet game service, in 1990 and the Total Entertainment Network in 1995.

David has a Ph.D. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University and a B.S. in Physics from Harvey Mudd College. He is the co-author of the cover article of the journal Science (January 20, 1995) and 14 other publications, including 5 in Physical Review Letters.
